snippet: Male harvestmen guarding their mates’ eggs are more attractive to other females of the species, a study found.
abstract: Dr Gustavo S Requena study in journal PLoS One shows that male harvestmen spiders, also known as daddy longlegs, are more attractive to females when they are guarding eggs laid by their mate.
lead_paragraph: Male harvestmen guarding their mates’ eggs are more attractive to other females of the species, a study found.

headline.print_headline: Single Arachnid Fathers Attract More Mates
headline.seo: Among Certain Arachnids, Single Fathers Attract More Mates
headline.main: Single Arachnid Fathers Attract More Mates
